entry.name: R2931
entry.text: R2931 The entity body of the root part of multipart/related MESSAGE MUST be a soap:Envelope.

entry.name: R2945
entry.text: R2945 The Content-Type HTTP header field-value in a MESSAGE MUST be either 'multipart/related' or 'text/xml'.

entry.name: R2932
entry.text: R2932 If the Content-Type HTTP header field-value in a MESSAGE has a media-type of 'multipart/related' then the Content-Type HTTP header field-value in that message MUST have the type parameter with a value of 'text/xml'.

entry.name: R2915
entry.text: R2915 The entity body of the root part of a multipart/related MESSAGE MUST be serialized using either UTF-8 or UTF-16 character encoding.

entry.name: R2916
entry.text: R2916 Non-root parts of a multipart/related MESSAGE MAY use any character encoding.

entry.name: R2925
entry.text: R2925 If the WSDL description lists at least one non-root MIME part, the corresponding MESSAGE MUST have a Content-Type HTTP header field-value with a media-type of 'multipart/related'.

entry.name: R2917
entry.text: R2917 A MESSAGE containing zero attachment parts MUST be sent using a content-type of either 'text/xml' as though a SOAP HTTP binding were used or 'multipart/related' when the WSDL description for the message specifies the mime:multipartRelated element on the corresponding wsdl:input or wsdl:output element in its wsdl:binding.

entry.name: R2902
entry.text: R2902 A SENDER MUST NOT send a message using SOAP with Attachments if the corresponding wsdl:input or wsdl:output element in the wsdl:binding does not specify the WSDL MIME Binding.

entry.name: R2918
entry.text: R2918 A RECEIVER MAY ignore a URI reference to an attachment in an envelope.

entry.name: R2919
entry.text: R2919 A MESSAGE MAY contain soap:Envelopes carried as attachments in parts that are not the root part of the message.

entry.name: R2920
entry.text: R2920 An INSTANCE MAY send a fault with attachments if and only if the wsdl:output element is described using the WSDL MIME binding.

entry.name: R2933
entry.text: R2933 If a description binds a wsdl:message part to a mime:content element, then the corresponding MIME part's content-id field-value in a MESSAGE MUST conform to the content-id part encoding.

entry.name: R2921
entry.text: R2921 A RECEIVER MUST NOT infer any semantics from the ordering of non-root MIME parts in a message.

entry.name: R2929
entry.text: R2929 A MESSAGE MAY have its MIME parts in any order provided that the identity of the root part is maintained.

entry.name: R2922
entry.text: R2922 If the Content-Type HTTP header field-value in a message does not have a start parameter, a RECEIVER MUST treat the first body part of the MIME package as the root part.

entry.name: R2934
entry.text: R2934 The Content-Transfer-Encoding field of a part in a multipart/related MESSAGE MUST have a value of '7bit', '8bit', 'binary', 'quoted-printable' or 'base64'.

entry.name: R2935
entry.text: R2935 The encoding of the body of a part in a multipart/related MESSAGE MUST conform to the encoding indicated by the Content-Transfer-Encoding field-value, as specified by RFC2045.

entry.name: R2936
entry.text: R2936 In a MESSAGE, all MIME encapsulation boundary strings MUST be preceded with the ascii characters CR (13) and LF (10) in that sequence.

entry.name: R2901
entry.text: R2901 A DESCRIPTION MUST use either the WSDL MIME Binding as described in WSDL 1.1 Section 5 or WSDL SOAP binding as described in WSDL 1.1 Section 3 on each of the wsdl:input or wsdl:output elements of a wsdl:binding.

entry.name: R2941
entry.text: R2941 A wsdl:binding in a DESCRIPTION SHOULD bind every wsdl:part of a wsdl:message in the wsdl:portType to which it refers to one of soapbind:body, soapbind:header, soapbind:fault, soapbind:headerfault, or mime:content.

entry.name: R2903
entry.text: R2903 A mime:content element in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT reference a wsdl:part that is not present in the respective wsdl:input or wsdl:output of the corresponding wsdl:operation of the corresponding wsdl:portType.

entry.name: R2904
entry.text: R2904 A mime:content element in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT be bound to a sub-component of an element or type referenced by a wsdl:part.

entry.name: R2946
entry.text: R2946 In a DESCRIPTION, a mime:content element MUST include the part attribute.

entry.name: R2940
entry.text: R2940 In a DESCRIPTION, a wsdl:part defined with the ref:swaRef schema type SHOULD only be bound to a soapbind:body, or a soapbind:header in a MIME binding.

entry.name: R2928
entry.text: R2928 In an ENVELOPE, a URI reference that is typed using the ref:swaRef schema type MUST resolve to a MIME part in the same message as the envelope.

entry.name: R2911
entry.text: R2911 A mime:multipartRelated element in a DESCRIPTION MUST contain exactly one mime:part element, amongst its child mime:part elements, containing a soapbind:body child.

entry.name: R2905
entry.text: R2905 The soapbind:header element in a DESCRIPTION MAY be included as a child of the mime:part element.

entry.name: R2906
entry.text: R2906 A soapbind:header element in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT be included in a mime:part that is not the root part, containing the soapbind:body element.

entry.name: R2907
entry.text: R2907 MIME parts in a DESCRIPTION MUST be defined using an element with a local name of part in the namespace of the WSDL MIME Binding extension.

entry.name: R2908
entry.text: R2908 The mime:part element in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT have a name attribute.

entry.name: R2909
entry.text: R2909 Multiple mime:content child elements of a mime:part element in a DESCRIPTION MUST reference the same wsdl:part.

entry.name: R2910
entry.text: R2910 A mime:content in a DESCRIPTION MUST reference a wsdl:part that is defined using either the type attribute or the element attribute.

entry.name: R2942
entry.text: R2942 In a MESSAGE, a message part bound to a mime:content that refers to global element declaration (via the element attribute of the wsdl:part element) MUST be serialized within the MIME part as a serialization of an XML infoset whose root element is described by the referenced element.

entry.name: R2943
entry.text: R2943 In a DESCRIPTION, if a message part is bound to a mime:content that refers to a type (via the type attribute of the wsdl:part element), then the value of that type attribute MUST be ignored in favor of media type of the type attribute of the mime:content element.

entry.name: R2944
entry.text: R2944 In a DESCRIPTION, if a wsdl:part element refers to a global element declaration (via the element attribute of the wsdl:part element) then the value of the type attribute of a mime:content element that binds that part MUST be a content type suitable for carrying an XML serialization.

entry.name: R2912
entry.text: R2912 A RECEIVER MUST NOT assume that the order of mime:part elements specified in a WSDL description is the same as the order of MIME parts in the message.

entry.name: R2947
entry.text: R2947 In a DESRIPTION, a mime:part element that contains a soapbind:body child element MAY appear in any position amongst the other child elements of a mime:multipartRelated element.

entry.name: R2913
entry.text: R2913 A Fault MESSAGE MAY be serialized as either text/xml or multipart/related, if the wsdl:output child element of the corresponding binding operation in a description has a child mime:multipartRelated element.

entry.name: R2930
entry.text: R2930 A wsdl:fault element in a DESCRIPTION MUST NOT have mime:multipartRelated element as its child element.

entry.name: R2923
entry.text: R2923 A SENDER MAY send non-root MIME parts not described in the WSDL MIME binding.

entry.name: R2926
entry.text: R2926 A MESSAGE MUST include all of the MIME parts described by its WSDL MIME binding.

entry.name: R2927
entry.text: R2927 The root part of a MESSAGE MUST be conformant with all the requirements for an envelope in version 1.1 of the Basic Profile.
